item.title: The Creator Behind Ico And Shadow Of The Colossus Is Making A Wild Sci-Fi Game
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/fumito-ueda-ico-shadow-of-the-colossus-new-game-ps5-1851720328

During tonight’s Game Awards aka a large trailer-a-thon (that’s also a game awards show) Fumito Ueda showed off a small glimpse of a still-untitled sci-fi-looking game featuring a big mech, a evil looking cloud of dark energy and a person in a cool space suit.

Suggested Reading

Live Forever in the Universe of 'New World: Aeternum'

Suggested Reading

Here’s the short teaser which features an ominous countdown and some stunning visuals. (According to the trailer’s description on YouTube all footage was captured on a PC.)

Apparently this is actual gameplay, or at least in-engine. (According to the trailer’s description on YouTube all footage was captured on a PC.)

The game is being developed by genDESIGN. In the trailer we can see a person climbing aboard a giant mech and then seemingly taking off in the head of the mech because its actually a giant spaceship... thing. I don’t know what’s going on, but it looks cool!

Fumito Ueda is famous for directing and creating beloved PS2 games Ico and Shadow of the Colossus. He then helped lead development on The Last Guardian via his own studio, genDESIGN. While that game wasn’t as popular as Ico or Shadow of the Colossus, it still maintined the same vibes as the Ueda’s previous titles.

It still seems like this is very early and probably a couple years away. I mean, it doesn’t even have a title yet! Still, I’m excited to check it out because Ueda’s past work is awesome and him making a sci-fi game has me very, as the kids say, hyped. Hopefully it has a less rocky development timeline than Ueda’s last game, The Last Guardian, and we get to play it sooner than later. For now, we wait and think about that giant mech head.

item.title: Harrison Ford Showed Up At The Game Awards
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/harrison-ford-game-awards-2024-indy-indiana-jones-xbox-1851720317

During the opening moments of tonight’s Game Awards 2024 event, Harrison Ford appeared on stage to hand out the award for Best Performance alongside Troy Baker—who plays the role Ford made famous in Indiana Jones and the Great Circle—and Bethesda’s Todd Howard.

Suggested Reading

Blasphemous 2 Developer Interview

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Before Ford walked out on stage to a thunderous applause, Howard and Baker talked about how well Baker had performed as Indy in the recently released Xbox and PC exclusive. But when Howard mentioned the other person who played Indy first, a big door opened on stage and John Williams’ iconic music started playing as Ford walked out to rapturous applause.

Here’s that moment below:

Ford was clearly very, uh, lets say “relaxed” during his big surprise appearance at tonight’s Game Awards, slurring his words and looking like he was checked out. Which, hey, I get it.

“I think this guy did a great job,” said Ford in reference to Baker’s performance in the new game. “If I’d known he was so good, I would have done it myself.”

After that, there was an awkward pause as Ford clearly didn’t want to say whatever was on the prompter and signaled for the teleprompter to move on to the award part, which it did as everyone laughed quietly and the trio moved on to handing out the award for best performance.

The winner of the award wasn’t Troy Baker, but instead Melina Juergens for her stellar performance as the main character in Senua’s Saga: Hellblade II. That means she’s won the award twice. And meanwhile, Troy Baker has still yet to win it, something Todd Howard joked about during the segment. Don’t feel bad Troy, Harrison Ford liked your performance and he’s never won a single Game Award, either. You are in good company.
